statement.tex: %text Using integration, find the area bounded by the curves $x^2 = 4y$ and the line $x = 4y-2$ %

reason.tex: %text The two curves will intersect when % \begin{align} y = \dfrac{x^2}{4} &= \dfrac{x}{4} + \dfrac{1}{2} \\ \implies x^2 = x + 2 &\text{ or } x^2 - x - 2 = 0 \\ \therefore (x+1)\cdot (x-2) &= 0 \text{ or } x = -1, 2 \\ \text{Hence, }P = \underbrace{\left( -1,\frac{1}{4}\right)}_{y=\frac{x^2}{4}} & \text{ and } Q = \left(2,1 \right) \end{align}
